As i read through the abilities, i came up with an 'All in' once you hit 6, just wondering if anyone could better it.
Dash in with e and blink for the auto attack, Auto one more time for 2 stacks of your passive, then use Q through them. this'll proc your passive as well as slowing them when the Q hits them, resulting in a double slow, a nice speed boost and  a decent chunk of damage to follow up with later with the W passive. while moving back to the safety of your minions, toss your W behind you onto the enemy champion, further slowing them. As soon as this lands, use your ult to jump back onto them, detonating the slow field and dealing a tonne of damage, proceed to ignite and throw in some auto's and they should decently close to dead. The only issue i could see with this is champs that thrive when you get close, running back to your minions could give them the opportunity to retaliate.

I hope this actually encourages smart game play.

To all that care, Ekko is **NOT** over powered in any state. If you have seen PBE gameplays or had a go yourself, you may think that he is in a bad form being a bursty cc champion with high mobility and chase potential.

A {{champion:7}} or {{champion:55}} can burst a single target dealing more damage in a shorter amount of time. 

Let's just say a {{champion:7}} is trying to burst her lane opponent, she does a lot of damage in one go, more than Ekko actually and her cooldowns are much lower **EVEN** though she has no cdr. 

So to all of those thinking Ekko is op (PBE, could be subject to change) he is not, as his main damaging ability is his ultimate and takes alot of skill to play.

If a Red could answer my question regarding his Q - Is there a gameplay reason why the Q's start and return path finishes in a small radius around Ekko, rather than at the center of his character model/hitbox? 

Having it return to the center of his model/hitbox would be a QoL change for a melee such as himself, as positioning himself in front of a retreating enemy prevents the second part of the Q from connecting even when it looks like it should.

For instance:

* {{champion:103}}'s Q comes out from the center of her model/hitbox and returns to the center of the model/hitbox.

* {{champion:34}}'s Q from center of model/hitbox.

* {{champion:201}}'s Q surprisingly comes from the center of his model/hitbox, and he is a melee character.

* {{champion:238}}, another melee champ, also has his Shuriken start from the center of his model/hitbox.

If such projectiles all start from the center of the character model/hitbox? why doesnt Ekko's?

It does return to him. It's like if Ahri, Dashes while her q is returning to her, It'll look like it's not returning to the center but it's just adjusting to the new position of the character. Since his Q is a slower projectile, It'll look like it isn't returning to the center more times than not. Especially if he uses his dash and stuff. Hope that helps you out
